comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:6.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0
Build ID: 20110816220025

Steps to reproduce:

Upgraded to Thunderbird 6 (fedora 15).


Actual results:

My address books are alphabetically sorted.


Expected results:

The address books should have been sorted by the position value, e.g.:
    user_pref("ldap_2.servers.TennisSeeders.position", 9);
comments.creator: greta_watson@stanfordalumni.org
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:6.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0
Build ID: 20110816220025

Steps to reproduce:

Upgraded to Thunderbird 6 (fedora 15).


Actual results:

My address books are alphabetically sorted.


Expected results:

The address books should have been sorted by the position value, e.g.:
    user_pref("ldap_2.servers.TennisSeeders.position", 9);
comments.author: greta_watson@stanfordalumni.org

comments.raw_text: What version did you upgrade from ?
comments.creator: ludovic@hirlimann.net
comments.text: What version did you upgrade from ?
comments.author: ludovic@hirlimann.net

comments.raw_text:
7/23/2011 went from thunderbird 3.1.11-1.fc15.x86_64 to 5.0-1.  8/23 went from 5.0-1 to 6.0-1.  I'm not sure when the bug was introduced.  I noticed it after I upgraded to thunderbird 6.

That was when I also noticed that one has to confirm every time one deletes an entry from Collected Addresses.  In my opinion, that wasn't a good change.  At the very least, we should have a settable option to not confirm.
comments.author: greta_watson@stanfordalumni.org
comments.text:

That was when I also noticed that one has to confirm every time one deletes an entry from Collected Addresses.  In my opinion, that wasn't a good change.  At the very least, we should have a settable option to not confirm.
